TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XpsSignatureDefinition extends System.Object

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about signature definitions in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] packages, see Chapter 10 in the XML Paper Specification (XPS) available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).
For information about <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> digital signatures, see the MSDN article Digital Signing Framework of the Open Packaging Conventions available at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=74494](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=74494).
For information about [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] see the XML Paper Specification (XPS) available for download at [http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).
## Examples The following example shows how to create and set the properties of an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsSignatureDefinition>.
[!code-csharp[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/CSharp/SignatureDialog.xaml.cs#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)] [!code-vb[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/visualbasic/signaturedialog.xaml.vb#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use this constructor.
[!code-csharp[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/CSharp/SignatureDialog.xaml.cs#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)] [!code-vb[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/visualbasic/signaturedialog.xaml.vb#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the of the signature.
Docs.value: The cultural information of the signature.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether unwritten property changes exist for the class and must be written to the package's stream.
Gets or sets the string value of the signature intention agreement that the signer is signing against.
Docs.value: A that represents the intention agreement; for example, "I have read and agree." The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about the `Intent` element of signature definitions in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] packages, see chapter 10 in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] specification, which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
## Examples The following example shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/CSharp/SignatureDialog.xaml.cs#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)] [!code-vb[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/visualbasic/signaturedialog.xaml.vb#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identity of the person who is requested to sign (or has signed) the package.
Docs.value: A that represents the signer, for example, "Mary Jones, Marketing Dept." The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property corresponds to the `SignerName` attribute of the `SignatureDefinition` element in an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] package. Notice the difference in the names.
For more information about the `SignerName` attribute, see chapter 10 of the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] specification, which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
## Examples The following example shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/CSharp/SignatureDialog.xaml.cs#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)] [!code-vb[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/visualbasic/signaturedialog.xaml.vb#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the date and time by which the requested signer must sign the parts of the specified document.
Docs.value: A () that represents the deadline by which the signer must sign the package. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about the `SignBy` element of signature definitions in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] packages, see the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xps-md.md)] specification, which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
## Examples The following example shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/CSharp/SignatureDialog.xaml.cs#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)] [!code-vb[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/visualbasic/signaturedialog.xaml.vb#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the legal jurisdiction where the package is signed.
Docs.value: A that represents the jurisdiction, for example, "State of Utah, United States." The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property corresponds to the `SigningLocation` element of signature definitions in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] packages. Notice the difference in the names.
The original producer of the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] package can set this property. Optionally, the signer can set the property at the time of signing the package if no one else has already signed.
For more information about the `SigningLocation` element, see chapter 10 in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] specification, which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
## Examples The following example shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/CSharp/SignatureDialog.xaml.cs#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)] [!code-vb[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/visualbasic/signaturedialog.xaml.vb#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a unique identifier for this .
Docs.value: A () that represents the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_id](~/includes/tla2sharptla-id-md.md)] of the signature definition. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To link a `Signature` element to this <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsSignatureDefinition>, you must set the `Id` attribute of the `Signature` to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsSignatureDefinition.SpotId%2A> property. For more information about `Signature` elements, see the [Open Packaging Conventions](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/xpspkg.mspx) schema.
For more information about the `SpotID` attribute of the `SignatureDefinition` element in an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] package, see chapter 10 in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] specification, which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
## Examples The following example shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/CSharp/SignatureDialog.xaml.cs#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)] [!code-vb[XpsReadWriteSign#SignatureDefinitionCommandHandler](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/XpsReadWriteSign/visualbasic/signaturedialog.xaml.vb#signaturedefinitioncommandhandler)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the location that specifies where to display the visible digital signature in an [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] document.
Docs.value: A that represents the location in the package where a visible request for a signature appears. The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about the `SpotLocation` element of signature definitions in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] packages, see chapter 10 in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xps](~/includes/tlasharptla-xps-md.md)] specification, which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
